title: Buitenverwachting 2017 Beyond Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: A floral character that leads the way on the nose of this lively wine, expressed in notes of lemon verbena, clover and baby's breath. Behind are fruity tones of white melon, peach and lime that provide a solid core to the lightweight mouthfeel. The lime pith-flavored finish is tart and refreshing. Drink now.

title: Campuget 2016 Tradition White (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Restrained yellow apple and pea notes are nuanced by hazelnut, salt and brine hints in this slightly savory white blend. Dry in style, it's brightened by fresh, lemony acidity and a hit of yellow peach on the finish. Drink now.

title: Celebrant NV Sparkling (California)
description: Dry but very fruity, this wine smells like a bowl full of cut apples, oranges and bananas and tastes crisp and citrusy as tiny bubbles liven up the palate. It's light in body and has good acidity to keep it lively.

title: Chasing Venus 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: A veritable tropical fruit bowl of aromas—with just the slightest whisper of grass—slides smoothly into a light- to medium-bodied palate of zingy acidity, slippery texture and plenty more ripe pineapple and guava fruit.

title: Château du Carrubier 2017 Cuvée d'Aurore Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Ripe, soft and richly fruity, this is an attractively smooth and rounded wine. With generous red fruits balanced with just the right acidity, the wine is open and ready to drink.

title: Château la Freynelle 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: The Barthe family vineyard, under the same ownership since 1789, is in an ideal place for white wines. Spice, ripe white fruits and acidity all come into play. The lively texture and fruitiness enhance this lightly perfumed wine. Drink from late 2018.

title: Château la Vivonne 2017 Domaine de la Vivonne Cuvée X Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A smooth, rounded style of rosé, this comes from vineyards close to the sea. It is soft, with attractive strawberry flavors lifted by bright, salty acidity. The wine is lightly perfumed, juicy at the end. Drink now.
designation: Domaine de la Vivonne Cuvée X

title: Château Les Combes 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Lychee aromas give this wine a perfumed character that follows through to the palate, which is full of great fruit and spice. This warm wine is ready to drink.

title: Château Roubine 2017 R de Roubine Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The dramatic embossed bottle with its flowered R contains a simple, less drama-laden wine. It has crisp fruits, almond and caramel flavors, ripe berries and just enough final acidity. Drink now.

title: Château Sainte Roseline 2017 Roseline Prestige Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The glass stopper and the elegant embossed bottle contain a smooth, ripe wine that is soft and easy to drink. It has a touch of bitterness while also showcasing ripe red fruits. Drink this easygoing wine now.

title: Chatham 2016 Vintner's Red (Virginia's Eastern Shore)
description: This Bordeaux-style blend is smooth and effortless. Bright aromas of black cherry, lavender, cinnamon and rooibos follow though onto the palate. Bright acidity on the finish leaves this feeling fresh.

title: Collection des Anges 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Crisp and fruity, this ripe wine also has good acidity. It offers red-currant flavors, with a bright texture to balance with the richer caramel and spice. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Colognola 2016 Via Condotto  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
description: This opens with yellow wildflower, citrus and white stone fruit aromas. The fresh palate offers juicy yellow peach, yellow apple and bitter walnut hints alongside crisp acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

title: Columbia Winery 2015 Cabernet Franc (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Caramel, cherry, plum, green pepper, herb, black pepper, tire rubber and wood spice are followed by sweet plump strawberry and plum flavors. It's an unusual offering of this variety.

title: Domaine de la Verde 2014 Prélude Red (Vacqueyras)
description: Subdued red cherry and strawberry notes are shaded by earthier notes of brine and soy sauce here. It's not deeply concentrated but is marked by pomegranate-like tartness and soft, feathery tannins.

title: Domaine des Aspras 2017 Les Trois Frères Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This blend of Grenache and Cinsault gives a ripe wine, full of rich fruit. Made from organically grown grapes, it has a crisp edge of acidity to balance the broad fruitiness. Drink this full-bodied wine now.

title: Domaine des Peirecèdes 2017 Le Fil d'Ariane Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Almost white in color, this elegant wine is rounded, full of ripe strawberry fruit and spice. The acidity is lightly crisp, well balanced with the tanginess of this attractive, ready-to-drink wine.

title: Domaine Gavoty 2017 Grand Classique Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A rich wine, this has ripe fruit and a generous texture. Spice, pepper and wild strawberry flavors give a rounded wine that is full bodied, zesty with a warm aftertaste. Drink now.

title: El Ganador 2017 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Berry and plum aromas come with a roasted side note. A crisp ringing finish is a bit shearing and acidic, while this tastes of spicy, peppery plum and berry fruits. A tight finish with chalky grip helps this end on a positive note.

title: Enfant Terrible 2017 Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: While delicate in concentration, this zingy, dry rosé invigorates with fresh watermelon and tart raspberry notes. It balances that juiciness with a crisp, acidic undertone.

title: Fairvalley 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Western Cape)
description: There's an attractive floral element upfront on the nose of this wine, supported by ripe notes of guava, pineapple and mango. The medium-weight palate offers enough cut to counter the fruity richness, while brisk, refreshing citrus flavors carry the close. Drink now.

title: Fattoria di Faltognano 2016  Chianti Montalbano
description: This wine's underbrush, dark fruit and baking spice aromas lift out of the glass. The linear palate offers clove, dried black cherry and star anise flavors alongside round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Fattoria Il Muro 2016 Spigallo  (Chianti)
description: This blend of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot has black currant and baking spice aromas. The easygoing palate shows black plum and clove notes alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Gray Ghost 2017 Gewürztraminer (Virginia)
description: Emblematic aromas of lychee, rose and ginger abound on the nose, with white grape, aloe and juniper. These tones are intense on the palate yet they carry a slightly soapy sheen. Medium in acidity and body, the fruit flavors extend the long, spicy finish.

title: Gruet 2012 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (America)
description: Brioche, white peach, marigold and butter aromas waft from the glass of this frothy sparkler made from Chardonnay. The palate feels oily, with flavors of almonds, lemon juice and more white peach, finishing on notes of bitter almond and dried apricot.

title: Hugl-Wimmer 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Subtle notes of ripe yellow pear on the nose are toned down by lemon freshness on the light easy-drinking dry palate. Lots of verve and juiciness make for an ideal aperitif or party wine.

title: Hugl-Wimmer 2017 Wimmer Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: Slightly muddied notes of pear appear on the nose. On the dry light palate it is lemon that takes over and adds welcome verve and liveliness. Very refreshing and easy with a dry finish.

title: Lorimar 2016 Grenache Blanc (California)
description: The nose on this twist-top bottling is a bit reductive at first, with a touch of petrol, citrus pith and Anjou pear rinds. That petrol quality extends to the sip as well, where is fits in with more pear skins and some beeswax.

title: Maison Ginestet 2017 Le Bordeaux de Larrivet Haut-Brion  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Crisp and perfumed as well as herbaceous, this is a fruity wine with lively acidity and a clean, bright aftertaste. Grapefruit and lemon flavors dominate this ready-to-drink wine.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2014 Right Bank Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
description: This blends in 7% Cabernet Sauvignon. The wine is pungent and earthy in forest and tobacco, with smooth thick full-bodied waves of green tannin and light accents of clove spice.
